comments.body: you are a pure genius
i love this.

this is like an absolute GENIUS idea i love it i love it i love it but i think there should be some more submissive paths for your dog such as 'mother' where they can make baby animals grow quicker (maybe they drop more food when they are older because they have been brought up well), 'sniffer' where you right-click on them while holding something (such as emeralds) and they lead you to it or 'hungry' where you have to feed them more but it gives you loads of xp (so this personality would be good for enchanting) these are just some ideas hope u like them
Yes, flesh the idea out more though, like what specific breeds should be in villages

I really like your idea, I would also like to suggest that dogs could have the ability to dig randomly and leave a gift to the owner they could have a chance of finding treasure like diamonds, emeralds, name tags, books of enchanting etc

As well as having different types of wolves/dogs depending on Biome, it would be nice to breed them and get a random chance to have a mutated colour / pattern of fur so players could have a unique looking pet other variations could include slightly rounder ears, bigger eyes, longer fur very slight changes but still a little bit different. 

A complete redesign of the current wolves/ dogs mob - change the shape and snout length make them look more like wolves and make them slightly bigger.

I will post my ideas here since feedback doesn't allow duplicate topics:

Basically allow tamed wolves (dogs) to be more intelligent and bring to the same level of complexity of newly-added mobs (like foxes, allays, sniffers...)

To start, add a third "behavior mode" for tamed wolves, that just make the mob to free roam on a specific area (without specifically follow the owner or teleport to they) with specific radius and center defined by a player using a dog bed. The dog would automatically choose a bed when one is placed near him and that would be the "anchor point" for when he is ordered to patrol the area. I think this concept is similar to how currently Villager works with their beds, right?

Plus, i think several of the fox behavior could be "copied" to either untamed and tamed dogs. Carrying a item in the mouth, for example, could also be a very interesting thing to implement on dogs's follow mode, to when we are carrying them on exploration and run out of space on inventory we could use then as a single-slot portable inventory. Also dogs could emulate the allay (and sniffers) feature of be ordered to search a specific item/block, and when found would grab the found items (over a full slot) to the owner. Althrough i mentioned Allays and Sniffers due to its similar behaviors, i wrote this idea more inspired by Fallout 3/NV's Dogmeat, that is able to get items for his owner as well.

Other addition ideas would be things like snarling mechanics instead of just run against the prey when attacking ("red eye" mode). Also, for dog breeds, i think implementing something similar to how the game currently treats cat breeds internally (i think there is a NBT tag specifying the variant/breed for each entity).

Finally, if one day Mojang/Microsoft would add variants/breeds please add the honey-colored mutt (Vira-lata caramelo) as one of the variants. üáßüá∑

Speaking of cats, i think it wouldn't be a bad idea if a separation similar to ocelot/cats would be implemented, splitting wild wolves from the domestic ones.

Also, PVP settings should be respect in servers: if on, not only players cannot hurt dogs from other players but also those dogs would not turn hostile to them.
Yes I would love this update my Minecraft dog died Because of dumb snow so pls make this happen I would play Minecraft even more after this‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èü•∞ü•∞
I hope Mojang can make the swamp biome in the next update. It was planned but it had lost the election from another biome.
And should drop scales that can be crafted into armor

This would be a mob that appears in a swamp or jungle, most often in one block deep water. Sometimes you might see it swimming in deeper water or resting on the shore.

He would not be aggressive by nature and would not attack the player on his own until the player comes close to him.
However, if the player holds raw meat / raw fish, instead of attacking, he opens his mouth, allowing himself to be fed and reproduced.
After feeding, it does not attack for a period of time.
You can?
Umm...I believe that's already a thing...
Oh wait...that's taming a parrot I'm thinking of...
I think that should make a nest and lay eggs like a turtle
Parrots should be breedable because of how hard to find they are in the wild.
I agree! with this addition maybe the parrots could make nests and lay eggs like turtles do and much like real birds it would take a while for them to learn how to fly

maybe it would be like you would give them 32 seeds 10 string and a stack of sticks then they would find a high place and build a nest over the course of say 5 minutes then they would lay like 5 eggs and they would hatch after about 3 days.
During full moon 50% of cats spawn black!

i think the thought process behind it is that it doesn't look shiny and yellow so they don't think its gold. Plus it makes you sacrifice at least one armor slot which isn't a lot if you have full diamond/netherite.

It makes sense but it makes gold armor redundant again, also yes its made of gold but how can the piglins see the gold under the ancient debris because in netherite you can't see the gold just its shape. If you want to prove me wrong then please do so

as Evan Diaz said, the point of gold is that they can have it, but more importantly it's a nice shiny material that seems special to them, in that case you would have to be able to barter with them with netherite
but its not shiny
Seems like a good idea, including that their is barely any rideable mobs in the nether

And then you fly up and suffocate in the ceiling.

No. No. No. I don't mind flying mobs in the Nether, but the Nether isn't meant to be a friendly place, I don't support flying mobs you can ride there because of the terrain is blah and I'd lag out (ever play MC on a non-gaming computer and try using the Elytra?) and either fall into Lava or suffocate in the ceiling.
Too OP. Makes striders basically useless.

Maybe a bit op woth the whole fireball and flocking thing. The flying is already quite crazy. It would be better if you had to constantly use nether pulp to control it, and using a fire charge while riding it will make it shoot firrballs. The flock thing is a bad idea, as I doubt mojang would lag optimize this. Also, making it hostile would provide more of a challenge to tame and obtain. Maybe add a way to make this end game. For example, they can't be bred unless you have a dragon egg in your inventory. I am not sure. Mojang should then make it so you can get more dragon eggs legitimately.
This would be cool but i dont think riding them would work well. maybe if they kinda worked like phantoms?
Seems OP maybe don't make it passive and have it attack the player?
Great idea! Maybe it would be attacked by the Ender dragon if it came near the main island? Maybe it could have a natural predator?

What Michael said. The ender dragon should be the only predator however since the outer parts of the end should feel safe when hovering over an endless abyss. I also think the mob name should be changed to a "Drift" and they should have a closer resemblance to a cloud with no tentacles.

How do these things breed then? And why do they lay eggs if they aren‚Äôt their offspring?

Now I like this idea. Currently the only " endemic animal" to the Nether that can be bred is the rather hostile Hoglin of the crimson forest. Makes a fair amount of sense for there to be an animal in the mirroring biome. There also is no way to get feathers to craft arrows in the Nether, your only hope is to not get killed fighting skeletons in the (otherwise rare) soul sand valley. Probably shouldn't be more complex than an overworld chicken and/or ostrich though.
I liked this concept but i would like if was a way of procriating them like hoglins to make an warpewattles farm
They also should live in crude villages

I think that piglins would spawn with 2-3 nether wart in their inventory to begin farming, and search for soul sand to grow nether wart on. That would make the nether wart patches in the nether wastes and crimson forests become hotspots for trading, like a smaller piglin bastion.

Actually this 'Happened'... I play windows 1.6 version.  I found Nether Wart farms at the bottom of several Piglin Bastions.  Average of 20 per bastion.  Still need blaze rods.  However, the Piglins do seem to now farm Nether wart at the very bottom of some of their Bastion.
Muy buena idea la mera neta

There's just one issue I see with this: It'd become too easy to get nether wart because they'd start planting it in Soul Sand Valleys. I think the best way to counteract this happening is to only allow them to plant nether wart ONLY if they already have some in their inventories, like that from a bastion. That way nether wart doesn't become extremely easy to get because random piglins that are nowhere near any sources of nether wart are just planting it in Soul Sand Valleys.
Or perhaps it depends on the pollen from the flower they most recently fed from.  A bee sting with a certain flower could pass along that particular suspicious stew effect.
Good idea

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
I'd rather not have this in the game since the Soul Sand Valley is painful enough to survive in as it is.
This could be a replacement for all the ghasts in soul sand valleys, but there should still be a few ghasts because soul stealers would rare.

Problems I've spotted and my suggestions:

This might make awkward potions too easy to brew. My suggestions to resolve this would be to program them similarly to brown mooshrooms. If fed blaze powder, they could be milked for awkward potions a limited number of times.

They might make overworld awkward potions too easy to brew. My suggestion for this would be to have them transform into a normal cow when pushed through a portal, sort of like a reverse skeleton-to-wither-skeleton transformation.

They might make finding food in the nether too easy for some players. If this is the case, it might be a good idea to have them only drop mushrooms, or maybe have them drop beef on peaceful and easy difficulties only.

They do not solve the problem of where to find glass in the nether. Hopefully a creative player or Minecraft developer will solve that half in another post or announcement!
Good idea. Nether should have more animals than only Hoglin.

Additional idea: now that we know that hoglins eat the new mushrooms, they should attack this type of mooshroom as well! It would make them a little more difficult to find, and would give them some interaction with the mobs in their environment.

This idea occurred to me recently as I've been building a nether base. This idea is rational.

When playing exclusively in the nether, mushroom stew is your only source of food (for now). A mooshroom cow is the next obvious evolution of nether food production. Not only do I believe mooshrooms should be native to the Nether, but the Mushroom Fields should be a Nether biome.

Alternatively, the upcoming Hoglin could have a similar nether mushroom variant.
RoyalRex2 they should only attack the crimson type, because hoglins are scared of warped fungi.

I agree. I am going to add them in a mod and when right-clicked with shears, they will spawn a nether cow found in the wastes and they will drop 5 of their corresponding fungus. They can be bred with nether wart blocks off of the huge fungi. When milked with a bottle, they give water bottles or other things. When killed, or like infernal cows, which would be found in the nether wastes or when the fungi is sheared, they will drop inferno-brisket, a nether version of beef, another food source besides hoglin pork. It would give fire resistance for 15 seconds when eaten, making it handy for getting out of lava.

Maybe Striders should follow the Warped Mooshrooms around, while the Crimson ones will be attacked by Hoglins. There is also the possibility that Hoglins would still attack the Warped Mooshrooms, but be more tentative about it because of their fear. The idea of them giving water bottles when milked is a good alternate for awkward potions, especially since awkward potions don't currently have a warped counterpart. I'd still prefer that Hoglins and mushroom stew be the main food sources of the Nether, but if the players and developers agree, having them drop normal beef is a possibility.

With the addition of soul fire in the nether update, this boss should attack using this new feature. For example, it could shoot blue versions of blaze fireballs, and a player would get a blue fire animation on the screen as opposed to the current orange one when hit. As the player is burning, they would take twice the damage, and all damage taken would heal the guardian an equivalent amount. Fire resistance potions would halve the damage. I would love to see Manta Rays in Minecraft, but they should have something else special about them because they sound like they would be just like dolphins.

Manta rays have incredibly deadly toxins if they sting you. I imagen that in Minecraft, they would behave kind of like bees; being neutral but will sting you if you damage them. Though they would pack more of a punch than bees do.

Just a correction, manta rays do not have a venomous stinger. I think they still have a vestigial barb on their tail, but it's not a threat to people.
That aside, a purpose to give a manta ray mob could be to befriend a manta and have it intimidate aquatic hostile mobs like the drowned and normal guardians. The manta won't actually attack these mobs, just keep them at bay solely with its large size. I don't know how you would befriend a manta, maybe add plankton as an item you can feed them with?
That aside, maybe there can be a very rare variant of mantas that's pink like the one that was found near Australia. Also just to give them some more flare, mantas sometimes jump out of the water in real life, so these manta mobs could do the same at random.
